pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11531963030/job/32103254540)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11532320704/job/32103996855)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11532320704/job/32103996754)

Thanks!
maintainer merge

Thanks!
maintainer merge
It's sad that these `wlog` proofs break every time you add a section variable.
I think this change is immune to future alterations.

I am still not a big fan of `clear` instead of restructuring section variables, although I thought that the new variable inclusion mechanism should avoid this behavior? (`g`, `Z`, `W` are not mentioned in the statement).

I think in this case it amounts to moving the composition instance from line 65 near `IsSeparated.of_comp` and make a section there with `variable {Z} (g : Y âŸ¶ Z)`. Then you have to add one `{Z} (g : Y âŸ¶ Z)` in L102 and one `{Z W}` in L149.

How does the new commit look?
(The new variable inclusion mechanism only works for `theorem` and not `instance`)
Oh I did not notice that. This is a good solution then.
I think this lemma deserves a docstring. Please mention something like "reduced to separated" and if you have the tag at hand, you could also use the shiny `@[stacks ...]`
I don't think this lemma is present verbatim in stacks. It is only a lemma in a part of a proof. I've provided a docstring for it and a stacks tag for the previous lemma.
Could you add some docstring here?
I thinks this can go into `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Constructions.Over.Products` and maybe you can recycle some of the results from there?

```suggestion
  âŸ¨by rw [â† Set.range_iff_surjective, â† hf.closure_eq, f.denseRange.closure_range]âŸ©
```
Only a side comment: If we do these translations more often, which I think is quite probable, it would be great to have an `overize` similar to `algebraize`.
Should this be `ext_of_isSeparated_of_isDominant`, and then we have two 1-line special cases where `s` / `\i` is the identity?

If `i` or `s` is the identity then the lemma is trivial I think.
But I can provide one where `s : _ -> Spec Z`.
Of course, you are totally right. Thanks for interpreting my comment in a useful way!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): morphisms into separated schemes are determined by a dense subset
